section.title: DynamoDB Primary Key
section.para: Describes an &DDB; primary key for an resource.
There are two types of primary key types: hash type primary keys, and hash and range type primary keys:

listitem.para: A hash type primary key creates a table that has an unordered hash index based on the AttributeName of the HashKeyElement.

A hash and range type primary key creates a table that has both an unordered hash index based on the AttributeName of the HashKeyElement, and an ordered hash index based on the AttributeName of the RangeKeyElement.

section.para: For a complete discussion of &DDB; primary keys, see Primary Key in the &DDB; Developer Guide.

section.title: Syntax
section.programlisting: HashKeyElement: AttributeName: String AttributeType: String RangeKeyElement: AttributeName: String AttributeType: String

section.title: Parameters
section.para: Each element type has an AttributeName and AttributeType, defined as follows:

listitem.para: The name of the attribute that will serve as the primary key for this table. Primary key element names can be 1 – 255 characters long and have no character restrictions.
The type of this attribute. This must be either "S" for string data, or "N" for numeric data.

note.para: For detailed information about the limits of primary key values in &DDB;, see Limits in Amazon DynamoDB in the &DDB; Developer Guide.
